text: Iraqi soldiers raising the Iraqi flag
over Ramadi a key moment in the battle
against so-called Islamic state in the
city center Iraqi troops celebrated
their victory over the militants who've
had control of Ramadi since May Licata
holler at vidinha to Ramadi Brigadier
General ya rasool was quickly on
television saying the city had been
liberated but other spokesman were more
cautious suggesting that is fighters had
retreated from most of Ramadi but there
were still pockets of resistance well we
are now on the final stage of
surrounding Isis in the area of sophia's
which can be figured as liberating or
Ahmadi after that the battle for Ramadi
over recent days has been an important
test for Iraqi troops their
effectiveness had been repeatedly
questioned in the face of the ability of
is forces to take so much Iraqi
territory this is the first time that
Iraq's Army has led a successful assault
on this scale these images of Ramadi
though show the cost of this victory
many of the thousands who fled from the
city will find they have nothing but
rubble to return to but for the first
time they will also know their army is
capable of rolling back the so-called
Islamic state Richard Lister BBC News
